required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Study of Milvexian Using an IV Microtracer With Additional Formulation and Food Effect Comparison in Healthy Participants
clinical_study.official_title: A Study to Assess the Absolute Oral Bioavailability of Milvexian Using a 14C-Microtracer and Oral Solution in Healthy Participants With Additional Food Effect Comparison of a Spray-Dried Dispersion Formulation of Milvexian in Capsules

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to evaluate the absolute oral bioavailability (amount of drug entering the bloodstream) of spray-dried dispersion (SDD) milvexian capsules in the fed and fasted states, and to bridge the exposures seen using only the oral solution.

primary_outcome.measure: Absolute oral bioavailability of milvexian oral solution (fasted)
primary_outcome.description: Derived from plasma concentration vs. time and urinary excretion data. Measured by liquid chromatography/mass spectrometry (LC-MS/MS) analysis.

primary_outcome.measure: Absolute oral bioavailability of milvexian dose 1 spray-dried dispersion (SDD) (fasted)
primary_outcome.description: Derived from plasma concentration vs. time and urinary excretion data. Measured by liquid chromatography/mass spectrometry (LC-MS/MS) analysis.

primary_outcome.measure: Absolute oral bioavailability of milvexian dose 1 spray-dried dispersion (SDD) (fed)
primary_outcome.description: Derived from plasma concentration vs. time and urinary excretion data. Measured by liquid chromatography/mass spectrometry (LC-MS/MS) analysis.

primary_outcome.measure: Absolute oral bioavailability of milvexian dose 2 spray-dried dispersion (SDD) (fasted)
primary_outcome.description: Derived from plasma concentration vs. time and urinary excretion data. Measured by liquid chromatography/mass spectrometry (LC-MS/MS) analysis.

primary_outcome.measure: Absolute oral bioavailability of milvexian dose 2 spray-dried dispersion (SDD) (fed)
primary_outcome.description: Derived from plasma concentration vs. time and urinary excretion data. Measured by liquid chromatography/mass spectrometry (LC-MS/MS) analysis.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of participants with Adverse Events (AEs)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 3 days after the last dose of the drug

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of participants with Serious Adverse Events (SAEs)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 3 days after the last dose of the drug

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of participants with clinically significant changes in vital signs: Body temperature
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 3 days after the last dose of the drug

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of participants with clinically significant changes in vital signs: Respiratory rate
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 3 days after the last dose of the drug

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of participants with clinically significant changes in vital signs: Blood pressure
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 3 days after the last dose of the drug

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of participants with clinically significant changes in vital signs: Heart rate
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 3 days after the last dose of the drug

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of participants with clinically significant changes in ECG parameters: PR interval
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 3 days after the last dose of the drug
secondary_outcome.description: PR interval is the time from the onset of the P wave to the start of the QRS complex

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of participants with clinically significant changes in ECG parameters: QRS
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 3 days after the last dose of the drug
secondary_outcome.description: QRS can be defined as the electrical impulse as it spreads through the ventricles, indicating ventricular depolarization

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of participants with clinically significant changes in ECG parameters: QT interval
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 3 days after the last dose of the drug
secondary_outcome.description: The QT interval is the time from the start of the Q wave to the end of the T wave

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of participants with clinically significant changes in ECG parameters: QTcF
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 3 days after the last dose of the drug
secondary_outcome.description: QTcF = Corrected QT interval using the Fridericia formula. QT interval is the time from the start of the Q wave to the end of the T wave

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of participants with clinically significant changes in ECG parameters: QRS axis
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 3 days after the last dose of the drug

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of participants with physical examination abnormalities
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 3 days after the last dose of the drug

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of participants with clinically significant changes in laboratory values: Hematology tests
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 3 days after the last dose of the drug

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of participants with clinically significant changes in laboratory values: Coagulation
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 3 days after the last dose of the drug

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of participants with clinically significant changes in laboratory values: Chemistry tests
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 3 days after the last dose of the drug

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of participants with clinically significant changes in laboratory values: Urinalysis
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 3 days after the last dose of the drug

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Healthy, as determined by no clinically significant deviation from normal in medical history, physical examination, electrocardiograms (ECGs), and clinical laboratory determinations
- Body mass index (BMI) of 18.0 to 32.0 kg/m², inclusive. BMI = weight (kg)/ (height [m])²
Exclusion Criteria:
- History of gastrointestinal (GI) disease, upper or lower GI bleeding within 6 months, intracranial bleeding, tumor, aneurysms
- History or evidence of abnormal bleeding or coagulation disorder and/or evidence of coagulopathy, prolonged or unexplained clinically significant bleeding, or frequent unexplained bruising or thrombus formation, or a history of spontaneous bleeding, such as epistaxis, or family history of coagulopathies
- Any acute or chronic medical illness considered clinically significant by the investigator
- History of clinically significant cardiovascular, renal, hepatic, dermatological, chronic respiratory, neurological or psychiatric disorder, as judged by the investigator
Other protocol-defined inclusion/exclusion criteria may apply.
